intro: Carpolobia alba var. parvifolia, commonly known as the white carpolobia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, white, five-petaled flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streambanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking unique foliage.
